title: US Rejects UN-Backed Report’s Finding of Famine in Gaza Strip
description: The US rejected a United Nations-backed report that declared a famine in Gaza, breaking with other members of the UN Security Council as it denied that Israel was engaged in a “policy of starvation” in the enclave as part of the war with Hamas.
content:
The US rejected a United Nations-backed report that declared a famine in Gaza, breaking with other members of the UN Security Council as it denied that Israel was engaged in a “policy of starvation” in the enclave as part of the war with Hamas.

Speaking before the UN Security Council on Wednesday, acting US Ambassador Dorothy Shea said nations “can only solve problems with credibility and integrity. Unfortunately, the recent report from the IPC doesn’t pass the test on either.” She accused one of the report’s authors of a “lengthy record of bias against Israel,” without saying who it was.
summary: The US has rejected a United Nations-backed report that declared a famine in Gaza, breaking with other members of the UN Security Council. The acting US Ambassador for the report accused one of its authors of having a long history of bias towards Israel. The report also suggested that Israel was engaging in a "policy of starvation" during the conflict.
shortSummary: The US rejects a UN-backed report that identifies as a famine, citing political reasons, while acknowledging the severity of the loss
